page.title: 12SPORT
page.content: Sport is quite popular nowdays. There is a cricket team in Combeinteignhead and a riding school in Stokeinteignhead. There is a youth football team which has to play all away matches because there is not a field in the village. There used to be a Bowling team. They played on a green which was turned into the pub carpark. There is a youth club on Mondays from 7.00 until 9.00. The Youth club organizes rounders, various sports both indoors and outdoors and once a month a disco. The primary school has a learner swimming pool but in the winter the children are taken to Torquay to swim. The nearest sports centres to the villages are in Paignton (Clennon Valley) and Newton Abbot (Dyrons). There is no village sports field principally because there is nowhere flat or suitable.
